title: 103_hr1198
content: The Trade Agreements Compliance Act of 1993 may be cited as the "Trade Agreements Compliance Act of 1993." It amends the Trade Act of 1974 by adding a new section for requests for review of foreign compliance. The Trade Agreements Compliance Act of 1993 defines key terms and allows interested persons to request a review of a foreign country's compliance with a trade agreement. Requests must be made within a specific time frame. The Trade Agreements Compliance Act of 1993 allows interested persons to request a review of a foreign country's compliance with a trade agreement. Requests must be in writing, include information on the failure to comply, identify the economic interest affected, and meet specific time frame requirements. The Trade Agreements Compliance Act of 1993 allows for reviews of foreign countries' compliance with trade agreements. Requests must detail non-compliance, economic impact, and meet time frame requirements. Multiple requests on the same agreement are reviewed together. The Trade Representative must determine compliance within 90 days of the last request. Factors considered include the extent of non-compliance by the foreign country. The Trade Agreements Compliance Act of 1993 allows for reviews of foreign countries' adherence to commitments made to the United States. The Trade Representative considers factors such as the achievement of agreement objectives and any acts, policies, or practices that may have led to noncompliance. The Trade Representative, after reviewing a foreign country's compliance with trade agreements, consults with relevant departments, seeks advice from the US International Trade Commission, and allows for public input. If noncompliance is found, the Trade Representative determines appropriate action under section 301. The Trade Representative determines actions under section 301 to minimize adverse impacts on US business relations and economic interests. The section does not require actions that conflict with US international obligations. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Amends the Trade Act of 1974 by adding a new section 306A for requests for review of foreign compliance.
